The provided code chunk is part of a method in the DirectScrolledList class responsible for dynamically creating and positioning visible items within the scrollable area. This method calculates the range of items to display based on the current index and the number of items that can be shown at once, then iterates through this range. For each item, it checks if the item is a string; if so, it either uses an item creation function (itemMakeFunction) provided by the user or creates a default DirectFrame with specified properties. This functionality ensures that only the necessary items are generated and positioned within the scrollable frame, optimizing performance and memory usage.

# Then show the ones in range, and stack their positions
        upperRange = min(numItemsTotal, numItemsVisible)
        for i in range(self.index, self.index + upperRange):
            item = self["items"][i]
            #print "stacking buttontext[", i,"]", self["items"][i]["text"]
            # If the item is a 'str', then it has not been created (scrolled list is 'as needed')
            #  Therefore, use the the function given to make it or just make it a frame
            if isinstance(item, str):
                if self['itemMakeFunction']:
                    # If there is a function to create the item
                    item = self['itemMakeFunction'](item, i, self['itemMakeExtraArgs'])
                else:
                    item = DirectFrame(text = item,
                                       text_align = self['itemsAlign'],
                                       text_wordwrap = self['itemsWordwrap'],
                                       relief = None)
